segment.source: AGPM Server Tab
segment.target: AGPM Server Tab

segment.source: AGPM Server Tab
segment.target: AGPM Server Tab

segment.source: AGPM Server Tab
segment.target: AGPM Server Tab

segment.source: The AGPM Server tab on the Change Control pane enables you to select an AGPM Server by entering a fully-qualified computer name and port, and to delete older versions of Group Policy Objects (GPOs) from the archive to conserve disk space on the AGPM Server.
segment.target: The AGPM Server tab on the Change Control pane enables you to select an AGPM Server by entering a fully-qualified computer name and port, and to delete older versions of Group Policy Objects (GPOs) from the archive to conserve disk space on the AGPM Server.

segment.source: Specifying the AGPM Server
segment.target: Specifying the AGPM Server

segment.source: The AGPM Server selected determines which archive is displayed for you on the Contents tab and to which location the Domain Delegation settings are applied.
segment.target: The AGPM Server selected determines which archive is displayed for you on the Contents tab and to which location the Domain Delegation settings are applied.

segment.source: The default port for Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is port 4600.
segment.target: The default port for Advanced Group Policy Management (AGPM) is port 4600.

segment.source: If the AGPM Server connection is centrally configured using Administrative template settings, the options on this tab for configuring the connection are unavailable.
segment.target: If the AGPM Server connection is centrally configured using Administrative template settings, the options on this tab for configuring the connection are unavailable.

segment.source: For more information, see Configure AGPM Server Connections.
segment.target: For more information, see Configure AGPM Server Connections.

segment.source: Deleting old GPO versions
segment.target: Deleting old GPO versions

segment.source: By default, all versions of every controlled GPO are retained in the archive.
segment.target: By default, all versions of every controlled GPO are retained in the archive.

segment.source: However, you can configure the AGPM Service to limit the number of versions retained for each GPO and automatically delete the oldest version when that limit is exceeded.
segment.target: However, you can configure the AGPM Service to limit the number of versions retained for each GPO and automatically delete the oldest version when that limit is exceeded.

segment.source: Only GPO versions displayed on the Unique Versions tab of the History window count toward the limit.
segment.target: Only GPO versions displayed on the Unique Versions tab of the History window count toward the limit.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: The maximum number of unique versions to store for each GPO does not include the current version, so entering 0 retains only the current version.
segment.target: The maximum number of unique versions to store for each GPO does not include the current version, so entering 0 retains only the current version.

segment.source: The limit must be no greater than 999 versions.
segment.target: The limit must be no greater than 999 versions.

segment.source: When a GPO version is deleted, a record of that version remains in the history of the GPO, but the GPO version itself is deleted from the archive.
segment.target: When a GPO version is deleted, a record of that version remains in the history of the GPO, but the GPO version itself is deleted from the archive.

segment.source: You can prevent a GPO version from being deleted by marking it in the history as not deletable.
segment.target: You can prevent a GPO version from being deleted by marking it in the history as not deletable.
